subject: Web3
title: Real-World Assets in DeFi
description: A 60-second lesson on Real-World Assets in DeFi.

hook.text: Treasury bonds, real estate, and invoices are being tokenized and plugged into DeFi. The real world is going on-chain.

buildup.text: MakerDAO invested billions of its reserves into US Treasury bonds. Traditional finance entered the smart contract.

discovery.text: Tokenized treasuries let DeFi users earn government bond yields without leaving the blockchain.

twist.text: Tokenizing real assets reintroduces trust. Someone must verify the real-world asset exists and is properly managed.

climax.text: Real-world assets could bring trillions into DeFi. They also bring the legal and trust complexities DeFi was built to avoid.

punchline.text: DeFi was built to escape traditional finance. Now it's bringing it on-chain.

quiz.question: What challenge do real-world assets bring to DeFi?
options: They reintroduce trust requirements for verifying physical assets
